page.title: 09Drainage in King's Lynn
page.content: Drainage in the area is overseen by the Snettisham drainage board.The drainage has been greatly improved in recent years.The 1600 mile bank, the original sea defence system, is now mostly ploughed up.The northern half of the area drains in a general north west direction,through a series of new dykes to the "New Cut", which eventually flows out through a sluice to the River Ouse.This has been greatly improved to become the Lynn channel.The south half of the area drains through to a dyke which follows the course of the A1078,flowing under the road by the Skoda factory,across and out through to the Ouse near the Dow chemical works.
